briefTitle: A Human Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Fermented Turmeric in Subjects Showing Mild Hepatic Injury

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Males and females 19-70 years old
* Mild hepatic injury as indicated by ALT(Alanine Transaminase) level ≥ 40
* Able to give informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Allergy or hypersensitivity to any of the ingredients in the test products
* History of reaction to any of the experimental products or of gastrointestinal diseases such as Crohn's disease or gastrointestinal surgery
* Carriers of viral hepatitis (type B and C)
* History of underlying Esophageal varices, hepatic encephalopathy, ascites(past 12 months)
* Participation in other clinical trials within the past 2 months
* Patients with acute hepatitis (type B and C)
* History of underlying cirrhosis and liver cancer
* History of underlying biliary diseases such as jaundice or gallstones
* History of underlying kidney disease such as Chronic renal failure or nephrotic syndrome
* Pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breast-feeding
* Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to interfere with successful participation in the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in ALT(Alanine Transaminase)
outcomeMeasures.description: ALT was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in AST(Aspartate Transaminase)
outcomeMeasures.description: AST was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in ALP(Alkaline Phosphatase)
outcomeMeasures.description: ALP was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in γ-GT(Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase)
outcomeMeasures.description: γ-GT was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in Serum Bilirubin
outcomeMeasures.description: serum bilirubin was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).
